posts.title: That Darn Cat!
posts.excerpt: Quote:When the irrepressible and always hungry D.C. (Darn Cat) turns up with a wristwatch for a collar, it becomes a tip-off to an unsolved robbery and kidnapping. You don’t know who’s tailing who as nosy neighbors, jealous boyfriends, and a highly allergic FBI agent play a game of cat and mouse to crack the baffling …

posts._title: Carlos Benpar – Cineastes contra magnats AKA Filmmakers vs. Tycoons (2005)
posts.title: Cineastes contra magnats
posts.excerpt: This is the first of a series of two documentaries concerning the way the cinema industry is not respecting the author works as they were conceived, in the many ways this can be done. This first documentary is dedicated to technical ways that industry implements thinking to be an improvement to make better public oriented …

posts._title: Yorgos Tzavellas – I Agni tou limaniou AKA Agnes of the Port AKA Lily of the Harbor (1958)
posts.title: I Agni tou limaniou
posts.excerpt: Captain Giakoumis makes the big decision to forsake the sea and live peacefully close to his wife and his adopted son, Andreas, who is about to sit for examinations in order to become a lieutenant. However, a terrible secret burdens his soul. He has a daughter, Agni, whom he had years ago when he had …
posts.titleEnglish: Agnes of the Port AKA Lily of the Harbor

posts.title: Antigoni
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:King Oedipus, the ruler of Thebes, blinds himself after learning that he inadvertently killed his own father, and got married to his mother. From this unholy union, Oedipus had four children: two sons, Eteocles and Polynices, and two daughters, Ismene and Antigone. After a tragic clash between brothers for the throne, the new monarch of …

posts._title: Natalia Chojna – Historia polskiego filmu dokumentalnego AKA History of Polish Documentary Film (2018)
posts.title: Historia polskiego filmu dokumentalnego
posts.excerpt: Quote:History of Polish documentary 1896-2016 is a collection of lectures by renowned experts, richly illustrated with film examples and curiosities, which presents the history of Polish non-fictional film in a cross-sectional way. The twelve-episode series is based on two volumes of Professor Małgorzata Hendrykowska’s book The History of Polish Documentary Film. The lectures produced as …

posts.title: Martha
posts.excerpt: S/S Martha is from 1927 and no maintenance’s been done since. Forgotten by HQ in Copenhagen, the Danish crew has a good, stress less time. But when they celebrate a virgin crew member’s 17th birthday by buying him a prostitute, the company director suddenly arrives with his daughter and takes control of the ship.

posts._title: Joseph Losey – The Damned AKA These Are The Damned (1962)
posts.title: The Damned
posts.excerpt: Quote:An American tourist, a youth gang leader, and his troubled sister find themselves trapped in a top secret government facility experimenting on children.

posts._title: William Lustig – The Violation of Claudia (1977)
posts.title: The Violation of Claudia
posts.excerpt: A tennis instructor leads a wealthy but neglected housewife into the world of prostitution.

posts._title: Alessandro Blasetti – Altri tempi AKA Times Gone By (1952)
posts.title: Altri tempi
posts.excerpt: The mood is set with the opening with excerpts from the Excelsior Ball, a famous ballet at the turn of the century that heralded the advances of the upcoming century, for a book-dealer to introduce the various stories in this compilation film. The first story chosen is (English titles) “Less Than a Day”, a comedy …

posts._title: Gregory Nava – The Journal of Diego Rodriguez Silva (1972)
posts.title: The Journal of Diego Rodriguez Silva
posts.excerpt: A young poet crosses into Nationalist, then Republican territory, attempting to escape brutes on both sides of the Spanish Civil War.
